TITLE: Can Affluence and Affordable Housing Coexist in Colorado’s Rockies?
SUMMARY: The outdoorsy lifestyle of Colorado mountain towns has become a magnet for the new remote-worker class, upending life for those already rooted there.

TITLE: Fed Officials Avoided a Victory Lap at July Meeting
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve officials raised interest rates at their July 26 meeting, and freshly released minutes showed they remained focused on inflation risks.

TITLE: New Union Leaders Take a Harder Line
SUMMARY: Pushed by angry members, unions representing actors, autoworkers and UPS employees are becoming increasingly assertive under new leadership.

TITLE: Biden Describes China as a Time Bomb Over Economic Problems
SUMMARY: The sharply worded comments are the latest example of the president’s willingness to criticize China even as he tries to ease tensions.

TITLE: Italy’s Government Takes Aim at Taxi Shortages
SUMMARY: The government took steps this week to increase the supply of cabs after months of shortages, but critics say the problems with the industry run deeper.

TITLE: Inflation Rose to 3.2%, but Overall Price Trends Are Encouraging
SUMMARY: Economists looked past the first acceleration in overall inflation in more than a year and saw signs that price pressures continued to moderate in July.

TITLE: Biden Orders Ban on New Investments in China’s Sensitive High-Tech Industries
SUMMARY: The new limits, aimed at preventing American help to Beijing as it modernizes its military, escalate a conflict between the world’s two largest economies.

TITLE: Biden to Restrict Investments in China, Citing National Security Threats
SUMMARY: The measure to clamp down on investments in certain industries deemed to pose security risks, set to be issued Wednesday, appears likely to open a new front in the U.S.-China economic conflict.

TITLE: Amazon to Meet Regulators as U.S. Considers Possible Antitrust Suit
SUMMARY: Amazon’s meetings with the Federal Trade Commission, known as “last rites” meetings, are typically a final step before the agency votes on filing a lawsuit.

TITLE: How Long Will Interest Rates Stay High?
SUMMARY: It’s pricey to borrow to buy a business, car or home these days. Interest rates are expected to fall in coming years — how much is up for debate.

TITLE: A Fed Official Wonders: ‘Do We Need to Do Another Rate Increase?’
SUMMARY: The head of the powerful New York Fed said that it was an “open question,” and that rates could fall next year.

TITLE: The New York Fed President Sees Interest Rates Coming Down With Inflation
SUMMARY: In a wide-ranging interview with The New York Times, John C. Williams pondered the economy’s future. This is the full transcript.

TITLE: Yellow, the Freight-Trucking Company, Declares Bankruptcy
SUMMARY: A pandemic-era lifeline that the Trump administration predicted would turn a profit for the federal government failed to keep Yellow afloat.

TITLE: Indiana Tests if the Heartland Can Transform Into a Chip Hub
SUMMARY: The state has little experience with semiconductors, but the Biden administration has promised to unleash opportunity in “the heartland of America” through the $52 billion CHIPS Act.

TITLE: Schumer Wields Political Heft in Bid for New York Chips Funds
SUMMARY: The Senate majority leader helped deliver billions of dollars in federal funding for semiconductors. Now he’s pushing for his state to reap benefits.

TITLE: How to Catch Pandemic Fraud? Prosecutors Try Novel Methods.
SUMMARY: Strained by limited resources, prosecutors are deploying special teams and nurturing local relationships to catch up to a wave of fraud.

TITLE: U.S. Adds 187,000 Jobs in July as Economy Cools
SUMMARY: Employers added 187,000 workers in July, a slower pace than the recent norm, but “more sustainable,” one economist said.

TITLE: Wages and Hiring Weigh on Minds of Company Executives
SUMMARY: Some executives said they were not expanding their payrolls as quickly as they had, while others were more concerned about wage growth, which has remained robust.

TITLE: Las Vegas Suffers as Nevada Economy Droops, Costing Jobs
SUMMARY: Nevada has the highest unemployment rate in the country at 5.4 percent as officials insist the economy must move away from its focus on gambling.

TITLE: White House Hits Back on Fitch Credit Downgrade, Protecting Biden
SUMMARY: The president’s team has mobilized to counter the downgrade of Treasury debt by the Fitch Ratings agency, rushing to defend the story of an improving economic outlook.
